benchmark_details.name: EHRCon
benchmark_details.overview: EHRCon is a new dataset and task designed to ensure data consistency between structured tables and unstructured notes in Electronic Health Records, featuring manual annotations of 4,101 entities across 105 clinical notes.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve the accuracy and reliability of Electronic Health Records by verifying the consistency between clinical notes and structured databases.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The inconsistencies identified may not be present in real hospital data due to preprocessing.

data.annotation: Manual annotation by trained healthcare professionals

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the comparison between predicted and gold-standard entity annotations.
methodology.interpretation: High recall indicates successful identification of actually consistent/inconsistent entities, while precision indicates the correctness of the identified entities.
methodology.baseline_results: Recall performance achieved was 61.06% in few-shot scenarios with the framework CheckEHR.
methodology.validation: Validation was performed collaboratively with practitioners to define labeling instructions.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All datasets are de-identified to protect patient privacy.
